name: 高級寫作（二）
restrict: ◎限大三修習◎必須先修過【ENU0287  中級寫作（一）】、【ENU0288  中級寫作（二）】、【ENU0289  高級寫作（一）】
description: 在「高級寫作」中，該課程旨在將學生在前兩年學到的寫作技巧，與他們對某個主題、學科或主題的知識相結合，以便為學生未來的職業生涯做好準備。本課程將使用不同類型、富有創意的文體，在不同領域進行情境化的寫作，內容可能包括與考試相關、與工作相關、或與研究論文相關的主題。以文字為主的寫作，也可能搭配其他的傳播管道，例如圖片、音頻、或個人/小組網頁等來進行。
goals: To help students rehearse skills in various modes of writing
Help students build a good sense of the difference between smart, sophisticated, quality writing and bland, hackneyed writing
Students are expected to integrate writing techniques with their knowledge of the topic/subject
syllabus:
**Advanced Writing** **高級寫作**

**Course Description** **課程描述**

The goal of this course is to help students write and think critically about contemporary social issues such as media violence and affirmative action. Students will read selected works and develop argumentative essay writing skills. Through in-class discussions and activities, as well as individual consultations with the instructor, the course provides the practice students need in honing essential critical thinking and writing skills.

**Required Texts 選定課本**

A course reader compiled by the instructor. 

(optional) _An Element of Style_, by E.B. White  

**Course Requirements 課程要求**

I.             Essay #1 (draft+revision)   70pts             Essay #3  40pts

               Essay #2 (draft+revision)   70pts             Essay #4

               (commentary/presentation)     45pts

II.            Quiz 1 & 2 (75pts each)

               --The quizzes will mainly consist of vocabulary and short-response questions related to the readings. 

III.             Participation & activities    125pts 

\--Includes discussion of texts, in-class activities, completion of reading exercises and presence at the individual consultation

**Attendance Policy**

Regular class attendance is vital to academic success. Three unexcused absences will result in a failing grade. If for any reason you can't attend a class session, please inform the instructor with a short email beforehand.

**On Plagiarism and Cheating**

Plagiarism is a **SERIOUS CRIME** and will thus be treated seriously. Refer to the NTNU Handbook for policy and disciplinary actions on plagiarism and cheating.
